text: One of your duties as the governor of your domain is the discovery, recommendation and promotion of talented individuals under your protection. In more stable times, the talented and the filial and pious would be recommended to the Imperial court for examination, but with the Han's authority shattered you instead have an opportunity. With scholarly refugees and their families fleeing from areas of warfare, and skilled individuals using the opportunity to rise up to forge their own fates, you are in a position to woo those of talent to your own ranks and cause. One day, a number of your clerks and officers present to you one name - the name of a notable and meritorious person who has been serving local government in some minor capacity. At their recommendation and advise, you invite this individual for an audience. After being impressed by them, you not only offer them a promotion, but an opportunity to serve you personally as a highly ranked and prized member of your own inner court.
